location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: The documents in the file are arranged in chronological order. There is an index at the end of the file (folios 25-26). The index is arranged chronologically and refers to documents within the file; it gives brief description of the correspondence with a reference number which refers back to that correspondence in the file.

The foliation is written in pencil, in the top right corner. The numbering begins on the cover, on number 1; then 2-4; 5A, 5B and 5C; 6-15; 16A and 16B; 17; 18A, 18B and 18C; and carries on until 27, which is the last number given on the back cover of the file.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Political Resident at Bushire, the Adviser to the Government of Bahrain, Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, and Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited (BAPCO) representatives on reservations for sand deposits near Askar.There are some maps within the file:'RESERVATION SOUTH OF ASKAR FOR SAND DEPOSITS' (f. 5B);'RESERVATION NORTH OF ASKAR FOR SAND DEPOSITS' (f. 5C);'A RESERVATION FOR NATIVE MUD DEPOSITS' (f. 16A);'A RESERVATION FOR SAND DEPOSITS NORTH OF JASAIRA' (f. 18B).There is an index at the end of the file (folios 25-26).
